result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah X Marzette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 133 days time served.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case and in case 15CF1540.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with MJF (DOB 2/9/99).

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

charges.descr: Attempt Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah X Marzette

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 133 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with MJF (DOB 2/9/99)
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case and in case 15CF1540.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Isaiah X Marzette not in court, in custody.  
Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing.  Due to the lateness of the hour (near noon) the court is unable to hear this matter.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Defendant was REMANDED pending sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript , commencing JUNE 9, 2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to MS. TERESE DICK, PUBLIC DEFENDER, 819 NORTH 6TH ST, 9TH FLOOR, MILWAUKEE, WI 53203 . kl

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Isaiah X Marzette not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served; original in court.  Case set for bail/bond hearing on 5-28-15, 8:30 as counsel already scheduled to appear on another matter.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 

*** Court makes findings that there is A possible victim identified therefore recompense is an issue. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.***
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Oral ABSOLUTE No Contact Order with the victim MJF.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, Defendant Isaiah X Marzette not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received and filed with court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in custody.  Ron Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference and Bail Bond Hearing is scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MJF dob 2/9/99

Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Isaiah X Marzette in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
